qas.question: When did iTunes become a sponsor on American Idol?
For how many seasons did American Idol put out a compilation of hits at seasons end?
What company has released studio recordings from American Idol since season seven?
Idol releases both the performances as well as what for sale?
How were the recordings released for the initial five seasons?
Because all five were in the top ten of Billboard's charts, this made Idol what?
Who joined Idol as a sponsor in season seven?

context: American Idol has traditionally released studio recordings of contestants' performances as well as <a3_0>the winner's coronation single<a3_0/> for sale. For the first <a1_0>five<a1_0/> seasons, the recordings were released <a4_0>as a compilation album<a4_0/> at the end of the season. All five of these albums reached the top ten in Billboard 200 which made then American Idol <a5_0>the most successful soundtrack franchise<a5_0/> of any motion picture or television program. Starting late in season five, individual performances were released during the season as digital downloads, initially from the American Idol official website only. In <a0_0>season seven<a0_0/> the live performances and studio recordings were made available during the season from <a2_0><a6_0>iTunes<a6_0/><a2_0/> when it joined as a sponsor. In Season ten the weekly studio recordings were also released as compilation digital album straight after performance night.
